H0.text: Soil is what plants use sunlight to make.

H1.text: Minerals are what plants use sunlight to make.

H2.text: Food is what plants make using sunlight.

H3.text: Water is made by plants using sunlight.

A4.text: The basic reaction by which organisms use photosynthesis to produce food (such as glucose) was outlined.

A5.text: The hydrogen freed by the splitting of water is used in the creation of two important molecules that participate in energetic processes: reduced nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide phosphate (NADPH) and ATP.
